qas.question: Who wanted war with the Soviet Union?
Who publicly wanted peace with Soviet Union
The British army was considered to be what by Walter Ulbricbht?

answers.text: the most reactionary force in the world

qas.question: Who rejected war with the Soviet Union?
Who wanted war with the Nazis?
Who privately wanted peace with Soviet Union
Who publicly wanted war with Soviet Union

plausible_answers.text: the most reactionary force in the world

qas.question: The British army wasn't considered to be what by Walter Ulbricbht?

context: The Communist Party of Germany featured similar attitudes. In Die Welt, a communist newspaper published in Stockholm[e] the exiled communist leader Walter Ulbricht opposed the allies (Britain representing "<a2_0><b7_0>the most reactionary force in the world<b7_0/><a2_0/>") and argued: "The <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>German government<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> declared itself ready for friendly relations with the Soviet Union, whereas the <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>English–French war bloc<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> desires a war against the socialist Soviet Union. The Soviet people and the working people of Germany have an interest in preventing the English war plan."
